explanation: This estimate is based on publicly available data and standard LCA methodologies, as there are no official carbon footprint reports or EPDs published by Apple for the iPhone 16 128GB. The calculation considers the following components: Material extraction and manufacturing emissions (~8 kg CO2e), transportation (~1 kg CO2e), use phase energy consumption (~4 kg CO2e), and end-of-life disposal (~2.2 kg CO2e). Material composition assumptions are based on typical smartphone components, with approximate proportions of metals, plastics, and glass. Use phase emissions are derived from average electricity consumption during typical usage over 2 years, assuming an average global electricity grid emission factor of 0.2 kg CO2e per kWh. End-of-life emissions account for recycling and disposal processes. All data sources include recent scientific literature, industry reports, and standard emission factors from the Ecoinvent database and IPCC guidelines.
